title: Equipotential map - claims for 5 labeled points

content.question: An isoline map of electric potential, with potential values indicated in volts, is shown in the figure for a distribution of charge. Five labeled points are also indicated in the figure. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The electric field at Point <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math> is greater in magnitude than the field at Point <math alttext="J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>.
There must be a region or point of positive charge near Point <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></math>.
The electric field at Point <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></math> is either directly to the right or directly to the left.

A negative test charge released from rest near Point <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> will remain near Point <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>.

content.answer: A negative test charge released from rest near Point <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> will remain near Point <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
